TextString.Name: PolicyHallCleaningDescription
TextString.String: A clean dining hall is appreciated by most customers.

TextString.Name: PolicyHallCleaningOneDescription
TextString.String: Cleaning the hall once a month provides unique decorations on most furniture and utensils. Effects No Ambience bonus

TextString.Name: PolicyHallCleaningTwoDescription
PolicyHallCleaningThreeDescription
PolicyHallCleaningFourDescription
PolicyHallCleaningFiveDescription
PolicyKitchenCleaningDescription
TextString.String: Hygiene in the kitchen is mandatory to avoid food poisoning or hairs on plates.

TextString.Name: PolicyKitchenCleaningOneDescription
TextString.String: Every night, before closing, you sculpt a food totem from all the leftovers to please the Rat King and prevent an invasion. Effects No Ambience bonus

TextString.Name: PolicyKitchenCleaningTwoDescription
PolicyKitchenCleaningThreeDescription
PolicyKitchenCleaningFourDescription
PolicyKitchenCleaningFiveDescription
PolicyToiletCleaningDescription
TextString.String: According to certain preposterous laws you need toilets in your restaurant. Keeping them clean may increase the overall olfactory appeal of your restaurant.

TextString.Name: PolicyToiletCleaningOneDescription
TextString.String: You are quite sure the walls weren't brown when you originally opened the restaurant. Effects No Ambience bonus

TextString.Name: PolicyToiletCleaningTwoDescription
PolicyToiletCleaningThreeDescription
PolicyToiletCleaningFourDescription
PolicyToiletCleaningFiveDescription
PoliciesCleaningDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cleaning Policies allow you to improve your Atmosphere rating.

TextString.Name: PoliciesMarketingDescriptionString
TextString.String: Marketing Policies allow you to gain Influence Points or focus on specific customer types.

TextString.Name: DecisionsGeneralDescriptionString
TextString.String: The Decision screen allows you to unlock special rewards or perform special actions.

TextString.Name: PolicyOutreachDescription
TextString.String: By spending on Outreach you can make more potential customers aware of your existence! You will gain Influence Points at the end of each day with this policy active!

TextString.Name: PolicyTargetDescription
TextString.String: Choosing one or two customer groups to target is the best way to specialize the restaurant and maximize both profits and ratings!

TextString.Name: PolicyRemovalDescription
TextString.String: Are some customer groups being cheap or leaving negative reviews? You can't put a sign up or tell them that they aren't welcome here, but you CAN do anything else it takes to keep them away!

TextString.Name: PerkPolicyRelaxingExperienceDescription
PerkPolicyEatLotDescription
PerkPolicyTrendyDescription
PerkPolicyProteinParadiseDescription
PerkPolicyLocalsOnlyDescription
PerkPolicyCheapPricesDescription
PerkPolicyEliteOnlyDescription
PolicyFlyersOutreachOneDescription
TextString.String: Flyers are for losers and they are like the first source of paper pollution! The better thing to do is to print just a couple of them and recycle them after they are thrown away.

TextString.Name: PolicyFlyersOutreachTwoDescription
PolicyFlyersOutreachThreeDescription
PolicyBillboardsOutreachOneOneDescription
TextString.String: Without a real budget you can only afford the name of your restaurant on a single carton billboard posted in the countryside.

TextString.Name: PolicyBillboardsOutreachOneTwoDescription
PolicyBillboardsOutreachOneThreeDescription
PolicyBlogsOutreachOneOneDescription
TextString.String: Who cares what people on the internet think? Who even uses the internet for things like that when everyone is insulting each other on social media?

TextString.Name: PolicyBlogsOutreachOneTwoDescription
PolicyBlogsOutreachOneThreeDescription
PolicySocialMediaOutreachOneOneDescription
TextString.String: You're doing well with rule #1, "posting a lot of material", but you really need to work on rule #2, "writing in a comprehensible language".

TextString.Name: PolicySocialMediaOutreachOneTwoDescription
PolicySocialMediaOutreachOneThreeDescription
PolicyNewspapersOutreachOneOneDescription
TextString.String: The only option for the budget you allocated is a small space on the last page of the newspaper.

TextString.Name: PolicyNewspapersOutreachOneTwoDescription
PolicyNewspapersOutreachOneThreeDescription
PolicyRadioOutreachOneOneDescription
TextString.String: Running your commercial during the night is cheap, but also quite useless.

TextString.Name: PolicyRadioOutreachOneTwoDescription
PolicyRadioOutreachOneThreeDescription
PolicyMagazinesOutreachOneOneDescription
TextString.String: Convincing your cousin to let you have a page in his "Flat World" magazine wasn't easy. But it's also not very useful.

TextString.Name: PolicyMagazinesOutreachOneTwoDescription
PolicyMagazinesOutreachOneThreeDescription
PolicyInternetOutreachOneOneDescription
TextString.String: Did you really believe that a massive image of yourself, smiling, with noisy music, would be a good idea?

TextString.Name: PolicyInternetOutreachOneTwoDescription
PolicyInternetOutreachOneThreeDescription
NoneDescription
TextString.String: Deactivate this particular stance of the policy.

TextString.Name: PolicyTelevisionOutreachOneOneDescription
TextString.String: Local TV stations will let you have a three second advertisement during their shows dedicated to fortune telling.

TextString.Name: PolicyTelevisionOutreachOneTwoDescription
PolicyTelevisionOutreachOneThreeDescription
PoliciesStaffDescriptionString
TextString.String: Staff Policies allow you to tune salaries and morale recovery.

TextString.Name: PolicyStaffSalaryDescription
TextString.String: Higher salaries increase the amount of Morale recovered by the staff at the end of the day

TextString.Name: PolicyStaffSalaryOneDescription
PolicyStaffSalaryTwoDescription
PolicyStaffSalaryThreeDescription
PolicyStaffSalaryFourDescription
PolicyStaffSalaryFiveDescription
PolicyStaffSalarySixDescription
